This makes the cad_component consistent with other 3D model formats and expands its modeling capabilities.

title: feat(pcb): Replace circular copper pour with BRep shape
description: This pull request modifies the pcb_copper_pour element by replacing the circle shape option with a more flexible brep (Boundary Representation) shape, allowing for defining more complex copper pour geometries, including those with arcs.
body:
This pull request modifies the pcb_copper_pour element by replacing the circle shape option with a more flexible brep (Boundary        
Representation) shape. This allows for defining more complex copper pour geometries, including those with arcs.                        

The changes include:                                                                                                                   

 • Removing PcbCopperPourCircle.                                                                                                       
 • Adding PcbCopperPourBRep and its supporting types (BRepShape, Ring, PointWithBulge).                                                
 • Updating the tests to reflect the removal of the circle shape and the addition of the BRep shape.

title: Add cadModel.gltfUrl support
description: Adds support for model_gltf_url in CAD component definitions

title: feat(pcb): add pcb_copper_pour element
description: Adds the pcb_copper_pour element to the Circuit JSON specification, enabling the definition of copper pour areas on a PCB for ground planes and net connections.
body:
This PR introduces the pcb_copper_pour element to the Circuit JSON specification. This element allows for defining copper pour areas on a PCB, which are essential for creating ground planes and connecting multiple components to a single net.                                                                                                     

Key changes:                                                                                                                                                                   

 • Added src/pcb/pcb_copper_pour.ts, which defines the pcb_copper_pour element with support for rect, circle, and polygon shapes.                                              
 • Included Zod schemas for parsing and corresponding TypeScript interfaces for type safety.                                                                                   
 • Added new tests in tests/pcb_copper_pour.test.ts to validate the new element.                                                                                               
 • Updated any_circuit_element and pcb/index.ts to integrate the new element into the overall specification.

title: feat(viewer): Implement PCB copper pour elements
description: Adds support for rendering pcb_copper_pour elements in the 3D viewer for both the Jscad and Manifold engines.
body: This pull request adds support for rendering pcb_copper_pour elements in the 3D viewer for both the Jscad and Manifold engines. Changes • Jscad Engine: The BoardGeomBuilder state machine has been updated to include a processing_copper_pours step, which generates the appropriate Geom3 geometry. • Manifold Engine: • A new process-copper-pours.ts utility was created to build copper pour geometry using Manifold. • The useManifoldBoardBuilder hook was updated to integrate this new processing step, which also handles subtracting holes from the pours. • Testing: A new CopperPour.stories.tsx story was added to test rectangular and polygonal pours on both top and bottom layers.

title: feat: Add support for OpenCASCADE OBJ files
description: This pull request enhances the OBJ file loader to support models exported from OpenCASCADE. These files often reference external .mtl files that are not included, causing the loader to fail when attempting to fetch them. Changes: Modified useGlobalObjLoader.ts to strip mtllib directives from the OBJ file content before parsing, preventing failed network requests. The loader now gracefully handles OBJ files that do not contain any embedded material definitions. Added storiesOpenCascadeObj.stories.tsx to test and demonstrate loading an OBJ file from OpenCASCADE.
body: This pull request enhances the OBJ file loader to support models exported from OpenCASCADE. These files often reference external .mtl files that are not included, causing the loader to fail when attempting to fetch them. Changes: • Modified useGlobalObjLoader.ts to strip mtllib directives from the OBJ file content before parsing, preventing failed network requests. • The loader now gracefully handles OBJ files that do not contain any embedded material definitions. • Added stories/OpenCascadeObj.stories.tsx to test and demonstrate loading an OBJ file from OpenCASCADE. /claim #454 /closes #454

title: feat(cad): add support for gltfUrl in cadModel
description: Adds support for specifying a GLTF model for a component via the gltfUrl property within the cadModel prop.
body:
This pull request adds support for specifying a GLTF model for a component via the gltfUrl property within the cadModel prop.                                      

The NormalComponent now correctly processes cadModel={{ gltfUrl: "..." }} and populates the model_gltf_url field in the underlying cad_component of the circuit    
JSON.                                                                                                                                                              

A new test has been added to verify this functionality.

title: feat(schematic): Add power direction arrows for pinAttributes
description: Adds the ability to display power direction arrows on schematic ports based on the pinAttributes property of a component.
body:
This PR introduces the ability to display power direction arrows on schematic ports based on the pinAttributes property 
of a component.                                                                                                                  

 • If a port's pinAttributes include requiresPower: true, an input arrow is rendered.                                            
 • If providesPower: true is set, an output arrow is rendered.                                                                   
 • If both are set, the port is treated as bidirectional and both arrows are shown.                                              

This feature improves schematic clarity by visually indicating the intended direction of power flow for pins. A new snapshot test
has been added for a chip component to verify that input, output, and bidirectional arrows render correctly on all sides.

title: feat(pcb): add support for brep copper pours
description: Adds support for B-rep copper pours in PCB SVG conversion, including a new utility function for rendering and comprehensive tests for various shapes.
body:
- A new utility function `ringToPathD` has been created to convert B-rep rings into SVG path data.                                           
- The PCB SVG conversion logic now processes `pcb_copper_pour` elements with `shape: "brep"` and renders them as an SVG `<path>`.            
- The `fill-rule="evenodd"` attribute is used to ensure that inner rings are correctly rendered as holes in the pour.                        
- A comprehensive test case has been added to verify the rendering of various complex B-rep shapes, including polygons, rotated rectangles,  
and pours with multiple holes.

title: feat(pcb): Add support for drawing copper pours
description: Add support for rendering pcb_copper_pour elements in the PCB SVG output, enabling visualization of rectangular and polygonal copper pours on both top and bottom layers.
body:
This pull request introduces support for rendering pcb_copper_pour elements in the PCB SVG output. It enables
the visualization of rectangular and polygonal copper pours on both top and bottom layers.

Changes

• New SVG Object Function: Created createSvgObjectsFromPcbCopperPour to handle the conversion of
pcb_copper_pour JSON elements into SVG objects.
• Supports rect and polygon shapes.
• rect pours can be rotated.
• PCB SVG Conversion: Updated convertCircuitJsonToPcbSvg to:
• Incorporate copper pours into the bounds calculation.
• Add pcb_copper_pour to the element processing switch case and rendering order.
• Testing: Added a new test file with snapshot tests to verify the correct rendering of rectangular, rotated
rectangular, and polygonal copper pours.

title: draw smaller arrows for sch ports
description: Reduces the size of arrows for schematic ports by adjusting the arrow size and stroke width calculations in the SVG rendering.

title: feat: highlight all traces under the same net

title: feat: Implement rectangular and polygonal copper pours
description: Implements the pcb_copper_pour element for Gerber generation, handling rectangular and polygonal copper pours using Gerber region commands (G36G37) and emitting the layer polarity command in headers to ensure filled regions are rendered correctly.
body:
This PR implements the `pcb_copper_pour` element for Gerber generation.                                                                
                                                                                                                                       
- Handles rectangular and polygonal copper pours using Gerber region commands (`G36`/`G37`).                                           
- Emits the layer polarity command (`%LP...*%`) in headers to ensure filled regions are rendered correctly.                                                                                          
- Includes a new test file to validate the output.

title: Feat: Add support for importing local .obj files
description: Adds support for importing local .obj files, allowing developers to use local 3D models for CAD components in their designs.
body:
This PR introduces support for importing local `.obj` files, which are returned as blob URLs. This 
allows developers to use local 3D models for CAD components in their designs.                      
                                                                                                   
The implementation includes:                                                                       
- Updating the file resolution logic in `resolveFilePath.ts` to recognize the `.obj` extension.    
- Modifying `importLocalFile.ts` in the web worker to process `.obj` files, create a blob URL from 
their content, and provide it as the default export of the module.                                 
- Adding a new test case to verify that `.obj` files can be imported and their URLs are correctly  
applied to a component's `cadModel`.

description: This pull request introduces a new packing strategy called minimum_closest_sum_squared_distance to the OutlineSegmentCandidatePointSolver and SingleComponentPackSolver classes. It implements a two-phase optimization approach to improve the packing of components in a circuit design, addressing issues with misalignment in previous strategies.

title: Straight Line Trace Issue Fix
description: Fixes the issue with straight line tracing in schematic rendering by adding new graphical representations for connections and paths.

title: fix(NetLabelPlacementSolver): Process each net only once
description: Fixes redundant net label creation by ensuring each net is processed only once, preventing spurious labels and islands.
body:
The NetLabelPlacementSolver was incorrectly creating redundant net labels by processing the same logical net multiple times under different internal IDs. This was caused by iterating over stale entries in an internal netMap after net merges had occurred.                                               

This change ensures each net is processed only once by first collecting a unique set of canonical net IDs for all pins in the problem. The solver now iterates over this unique set, preventing the creation of spurious "port-only" islands and redundant labels.

description: This pull request introduces several new example files and tests that reproduce major active issues in the core schematic trace solver. The examples are designed to help developers understand and address existing problems in the codebase.

title: Attempt to fix infinite loop issue with trace solver

title: feat(solver): Implement jog-based trace overlap resolution
description: Addresses a limitation in the TraceOverlapShiftSolver where it would fail to resolve overlaps on trace segments connected directly to pins by implementing a jog-based resolution strategy and increasing overlap detection tolerance.
body: This pull request addresses a limitation in the TraceOverlapShiftSolver where it would fail to resolve overlaps on trace segments connected directly to pins. Problem: The previous implementation of the TraceOverlapIssueSolver explicitly skipped terminal segments, leaving overlaps unresolved if they occurred at the beginning or end of a trace path. Additionally, the overlap detection tolerance was too low, sometimes failing to identify co-linear traces. Solution: This PR introduces a more robust overlap resolution strategy: 1 - Jogging for Terminal Segments: Instead of ignoring segments connected to pins, the solver now creates a "jog"—a small orthogonal detour—to shift the segment away from the conflict. This is achieved by splicing new points into the trace path, which moves the segment without altering the fixed pin position. 2 - Improved Internal Segment Shifting: The logic for shifting internal (non-terminal) segments is preserved and has been slightly refactored for clarity within the new implementation. 3 - Increased Overlap Tolerance: The EPS value in TraceOverlapShiftSolver has been increased to 2e-3 to more reliably detect and resolve co-linear and nearly co-linear trace overlaps. 4 - New Test Case: A new test case (example16) and a corresponding debugger page have been added. This example specifically demonstrates the terminal overlap problem and is now resolved correctly with the new logic, serving as a regression test. Both traces shift here: /claim #26 /closes #26

title: Ensure net label placement doesn't fail, even if there's overlap, "fallback" net label placement
description: Fixes net label placement failure by implementing a fallback mechanism when overlaps occur during placement.

title: feat(routing): Introduce U-turn support for elbow routing
description: Add U-turn generation for short traces in schematic trace generation, adjusting routing logic to accommodate U-turns and modifying example parameters accordingly.
body:
/claim #20
This commit introduces several changes to improve
schematic trace generation:

1.  **Add U-turn generation for short traces:**
    New logic has been implemented in
`generateElbowVariants` to detect and handle cases
where a trace needs to make a U-turn. When a path
overshoots its destination and needs to double back,
the trace is expanded with additional segments to
create a clean U-turn. This currently applies to
traces with 3 segments (4 points).

2.  **Adjust `firstMovableIndex` for elbow
variants:**
    The `firstMovableIndex` in
`generateElbowVariants` has been changed from 2 to 1.
0 is the starting point in an array. This fixes the routing of
elbow variants by making the segment adjacent to the
The starting point is movable, which is necessary for the
U-turn feature.

3.  **Increase `maxMspPairDistance` for example08:**
    The `maxMspPairDistance` in
`site/examples/example08.page.tsx` has been increased
to 5 to accommodate the specific layout of that
example.


https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/dd5d2825-5c1c-44b3-bf76-d8cad6b79e3f
